captions.text: Whats up I'm Ryan Tuerck and in this episode of Tuerck'd!
We are up here in Northern New Hampshire at the Tim O'Neil Rally School
Gonna be ripping some Subarus around
and I got my special guest with me this time, Bucky Lasek
driver of the Suburu STI and the GRC at X Games
and we're gonna go tear it up and have a blast here
Team O'Neil has given us free reign on their property to do what we want
For me, a lot of rally beginner training and for Bucky a little refresher before he hits the circuit this year
I feel so empty withouit my harness
I know I had a blast, Bucky you ready to take this on?
Yeah, I saw some cool things out there that we could set up. We should do some challenges.
We're gonna put you in a happy state of mind to see if you'll do something stupid.
You need to clip each one of these.
Got em all. Thats a good start.
This course is pretty tough right now.
I don't want him to win.
There's a second set of cones and a bonus set up right here...
Did he get that?
Didn't quite get the bonus, missed the other bonus.
Then you're gonna come down here, and you're gonna spin around, and put in in reverse.
So we tallied the times, and with all the penalties: Bucky, you won by four seconds
I can keep my day job

title: Rally Challenge With Ryan Tuerck & Bucky Lasek At Team O'Neil: Tuerck'd Ep. 7

comments.text:
It's rally time! Professional Formula Drift driver Ryan Tuerck and pro 
skateboarder and Subaru Puma STI Rally driver Bucky Lasek meet up at Team 
O' Neil Rally School in New Hampshire for some winter hooning. ﻿
comments.author: Motherboard

comments.text:
Check out Ryan Tuerck's latest GoPro burnout response today answering your 
questions from this episode!
comments.author: Network A

comments.text:
Yeah, forgot to log in to my Net A account. This is my personal youtube 
account.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: Yo Ryan, What is your dream car?

comments.text: You're fake wuttt or is that a second account?

comments.text: Thank you for the reply Ryan :)
comments.author: Skreamies

comments.text:
It is def a good platform. It has a really short wheelbase and an engine 
with no horsepower. Adding more power will make it a little easier to drift 
such a short wheelbase car.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
That would be amazing. Probably not doable since overhead costs would be so 
high.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: Yes and yes!
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: I thought it was awesome! Dude is a legend.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: I have driven a few RHD cars but not very often.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
There were soo many problems and hardships trying to make it. Money was of 
course always of a major concern. Finding the funding to do the series was 
another concern, and building a car that didn't break on the track all the 
time was tough as well.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
I would love to do Rallycross, but I would need some more experience and 
need to find some major funding to make that happen.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
Because I live in the US. I would love to but there would be soo much to 
figure out.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: show him a picture and tell him that is what you want.

comments.text: Thanks Trevor.

comments.text: I prefer whatever works awesome and is a blast to drive.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: The missile car has a welded diff and the 1jz car has a Tomei 2-way LSD.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text: Of course, Nobody is perfect.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
Whats up Trevor? I would suggest some of the other older Japanese cars like 
RX7's. There really isn't too much else unless you can afford a 350z.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
Yo man. I am using KW variant 2's on my 1jz car. Spring rates 8kg front and 
4kg Rear. We also run KW Variant 3's on our Formula Drift car with 
different spring rates. Some of the best suspension I have ever used in 
competition.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
They are only available to DA team members at the moment. I will push to 
get some for sale soon.
comments.author: Ryan Tuerck

comments.text:
Hear Bucky; You want to rally? Do some actual stage rally. Not this GRC 
show-pony shit.
